titles: A declaration, or representation from His Excellency, Sir Thomas Fairfax, and the Army under his command humbly tendred to the Parliament, concerning the iust and fundamentall rights and liberties of themselves and the kingdome. With some humble proposals and desires. By the appointment of his Excellency Sir Thomas Fairfax, with the officers and souldiers of his Army. Signed John Rushworth, secretary.
author: England and Wales. Army.
Fairfax, Thomas Fairfax, Baron, 1612-1671. aut
notes: B4v reads: June 14th. 1647. By the appointment of his Excellency Sir Thomas Fairfax, with the officers and souldiery of his army, signed, Io: Rushworth secretary. Finis.
Reproduction of the original in the Cambridge University Library.
keywords: England and Wales. --  Army --  Political activity --  Early works to 1800.
Great Britain --  History --  Civil War, 1642-1649 --  Early works to 1800.
